name: Assassin
flavor: A specialist role fit for survival that operates outside the normal rules of the Island.

sections.title: Core Rules
bullets: If the Assassin is not kicked off, any player who voted for the Assassin that day becomes a valid target the following day.
Valid targets expire after that following day (they are not valid the day after).
Can assassinate a player who is in Prison unless it is a Sacred Prison.

sections.title: Assassination Stats
bullets: Base Kill Chance: 25%
Base Survival Chance when attacked: 50%
If the target is poisoned, kill chance increases by +12.5% for each poison on that day (does not carry over).
May poison once per day: target loses 1 Health Point and 1 Food Point.
If given the Machete From Hell, base kill chance becomes 50% while the Assassin has it.

sections.title: Request an Assassination
bullets: Players can request an assassination through the Game Hosts.
The Assassin only receives the target: "You have been requested to assassinate PLAYER X".
Only accepted requests cost the requester 2 Health Points regardless of outcome.
The Assassin may accept multiple requests, deny any request, and choose which to carry out.
Failed assassinations are not announced.

sections.title: Global Announcements
bullets: PLAYER X has been Assassinated
ASSASSIN has received the MACHETE FROM HELL
Poisons are not announced and failed attempts are not announced.

sections.title: Information Revealed via Successful Interrogation or Luminous Shell
bullets: ASSASSIN is poisoning PLAYER X
ASSASSIN has accepted request to kill PLAYER X
ASSASSIN is voting for PLAYER X
Interrogator Only (Day Before): ASSASSIN poisoned PLAYER X
Interrogator Only (Day Before): ASSASSIN accepted request to kill PLAYER X
Interrogator Only (Day Before): ASSASSIN had voted for PLAYER X
Only accepted requests are mentioned (requests made in general are not).

sections.title: Extra Action
bullets: May poison again (same player or a different player).

name: Bard
flavor: A performer who influences morale, weather, and storytelling.

sections.title: Abilities
bullets: Play a song to increase the chances of a selected weather by 50%.
Selectable weather: Hot, Cold, Rainy, Clear, Heat Wave, or Freezing.
Weather chances become 75% with Teacher Buff and 100% with the Weather Rock from the Builder.
Harmonically raise morale: choose a survivor to gain 2 Health Points (can target yourself).
Tell any story to a survivor (commonly used for lying via DM).

sections.title: Global Announcements
bullets: BARD is playing SONG to make the Weather SELECTED WEATHER
BARD is playing SONG to boost the morale of PLAYER X
BARD is storytelling STORY

sections.title: Information Revealed via Successful Interrogation or Luminous Shell

BARD is playing SONG to boost the morale of PLAYER X
BARD is storytelling to PLAYER X
BARD is voting for PLAYER X
Interrogator Only (Day Before): BARD voted for PLAYER X
Interrogator Only (Day Before): BARD told a story to PLAYER X

sections.title: Extra Action
bullets: May do one action again: weather song, morale boost, or storytelling.
If the same weather is selected again, chances do not increase (used mainly to swap to a different weather).
A second morale boost cannot target the same player as the first.

name: Blacksmith
flavor: Makes weapons and armor to increase survivability across the Island.

sections.title: Armor
bullets: Blacksmith has permanent armor: +45% survival chance when attacked.
With Teacher Buff, Blacksmith armor becomes 75%.
May give armor to any player: +45% survival chance (75% with Teacher Buff).
Granted armor expires the following day; Blacksmith chooses again each day.
Armor may be given to the same player on multiple days.

sections.title: Machete From Hell
bullets: Can craft the Machete From Hell at any time.
Only 1 Machete From Hell can be crafted.
May be given to Assassin, Interrogator, or Nightguard.
Once given, Blacksmith cannot dictate how it is used unless it is returned willingly.
If the holder is killed or kicked off, the Machete From Hell returns to the Blacksmith.

sections.title: Global Announcements
bullets: BLACKSMITH is giving armor to PLAYER X
BLACKSMITH has crafted the MACHETE FROM HELL
BLACKSMITH has given the MACHETE FROM HELL to PLAYER X

sections.title: Information Revealed via Successful Interrogation or Luminous Shell
bullets: BLACKSMITH is giving armor to PLAYER X
BLACKSMITH has crafted the MACHETE FROM HELL
BLACKSMITH is giving the MACHETE FROM HELL to PLAYER X
BLACKSMITH is voting for PLAYER X
Interrogator Only (Day Before): BLACKSMITH voted for PLAYER X

sections.title: Extra Action
bullets: May hand out armor to another player (cannot be the same player as earlier that day).

name: Builder
flavor: A master craftsman and architect who shapes the Island’s survival through structures.

sections.title: Special Builds
bullets: Special Builds take 1 day to build (start Day 1, functional Day 2).
Weather Rock: Bard dictates weather at 100% and may boost morale of 2 players.
Sacred Jail: prevents jailed player from using Secret Roles and voting; Assassin cannot assassinate; jailed player cannot be poisoned.
Taller Nightguard Tower: South area fully seen; Cannibal/Werewolf can only attack from North/East/West.
Lecture Hall: Teacher may buff 2 people (only this part changes).

sections.title: Shelter
bullets: At end of each day, Builder chooses a shelter to build for the next day (quality is based on Builder’s creativity).
Examples: tiny shack (Bad Shelter) vs mansion (Good Shelter).

sections.title: Removal & Destruction
bullets: Builder may immediately remove a Special Build or stop construction at any time.
May remove multiple Special Builds in a single day.
Builder’s structures are removed if the Builder is kicked off or killed.

sections.title: Global Announcements
bullets: BUILDER has made SHELTER for The Island
BUILDER has started construction of SPECIAL BUILD
BUILDER has completed construction of the SPECIAL BUILD
BUILDER has demolished SPECIAL BUILD

sections.title: Information Revealed via Successful Interrogation or Luminous Shell

BUILDER is going to construct SPECIAL BUILD
BUILDER is going to demolish SPECIAL BUILD
BUILDER is voting for PLAYER X
Interrogator Only (Day Before): BUILDER voted for PLAYER X

sections.title: Extra Action
bullets: May start another Special Build on the same day they already started a Special Build.

name: Cook
flavor: Creates meals and poisons as long as there is at least one Hunter or Fisher on the Island.

sections.title: Special Meals
bullets: Gourmet Scorpion Stew: heal 5 people for +2 Health and +2 Food (must heal 5 if 5+ players).
DoorDashed Box Combo: arrives next day; grants immunity from being kicked off (not killed); 3-day cooldown; cannot be used in Top 4.
Shura’s 2am Spaghetti: takes effect next day; grants +45% chance to survive an attack.

sections.title: Poison
bullets: May poison someone for 1 Health Point and 2 Hunger Points (damage).

sections.title: Global Announcements
bullets: COOK has made SPECIAL MEAL
COOK has ordered The DOORDASHED BOX COMBO
COOK has given GOURMET SCORPION STEW to SELECTED PLAYERS
COOK has given SPECIAL MEAL to PLAYER X

sections.title: Information Revealed via Successful Interrogation or Luminous Shell

COOK is giving SPECIAL MEAL to PLAYER X
COOK is ordering DOORDASHED BOX COMBO
COOK is poisoning PLAYER X
COOK is voting for PLAYER X
Interrogator Only (Day Before): COOK voted for PLAYER X
Interrogator Only (Day Before): COOK poisoned PLAYER X

sections.title: Extra Action
bullets: May poison again, but cannot poison the same person they poisoned that day.
May make another Special Meal, but cannot order another Box Combo if it is ordered or on cooldown.

name: Farmer
flavor: Grows Special Crops with success rates and weather modifiers to grant powerful effects.

sections.title: Special Crops
bullets: Sneaky Spinach (50%): immune to Cannibal/Werewolf nighttime attacks; Assassin can see through it; protects against nothing else.
Lively Lemons (70%): grants an extra action for the day (Farmer may only use two Lively Lemons in a day).
Tasty Tangerine (70%): replenish 3 Health and 3 Hunger.
Trippy Tulips (70%): prevents the consumer from using their role or voting for the day.
Golden Apple (100%): invincible for a day (immune to death, damage, and being kicked off) and restores all Health and Food; rots in Top 5; takes 3 Active days to grow; only 1 can be grown.

sections.title: Storage
bullets: May store 1 Special Crop for a later date.
If a crop is stored, the Farmer may still plant and grow another crop that day and use both.

sections.title: Weather Modifiers
bullets: Hot: +10% to base chance
Cold / Rainy / Clear: no change
Freezing or Heat Wave: −20% to base chance
Old McDonald’s Overalls guarantees a successful harvest regardless of weather.

sections.title: Global Announcements
bullets: FARMER has successfully grown SPECIAL CROP
FARMER has failed to grow SPECIAL CROP
FARMER has given SPECIAL CROP to PLAYER X
FARMER has used SPECIAL CROP
FARMER has started growing the GOLDEN APPLE
FARMER has received "Old McDonald's Overalls"

sections.title: Information Revealed via Successful Interrogation or Luminous Shell
bullets: FARMER is growing SPECIAL CROP
FARMER is giving SPECIAL CROP to PLAYER X
FARMER is using SPECIAL CROP
FARMER is voting for PLAYER X
Interrogator Only (Day Before): FARMER voted for PLAYER X

sections.title: Extra Action
bullets: May grow a Special Crop again and give/use it that same day or save it.
Does not speed up Golden Apple growth.

name: Fisher
flavor: Fishes for random Special Items with rarity, storage, and weather modifiers.

sections.title: Special Items
bullets: Luminous Seashell (15%): see a player’s actions and vote on the day it is used.
Gleaming Sardine Scale (15%): +50% chance to survive an attack (not boosted by Teacher Buff).
Cursed Cuttlefish Ink (15%): blinds the target (cannot use role or vote).
The Black Pearl (15%): either summon a Sea Beast arriving the following day (choose on Rainy day) OR gain +2 Health but remove all protection including Priest Pendant.
Moby Dick’s Harpoon (10%): slay any Sea Beast; only 1 can be found.

sections.title: Storage & Food Dependency
bullets: May store 1 Special Item for later and still fish again the next day.
If an item is stored, Fisher may use both the stored item and the newly caught item that day.
Fisher depends on Cook for food; if no Cook exists, food is not gained from Fisher (but fishing for items still works).

sections.title: Weather Modifiers
bullets: Rainy: +10% to Moby Dick’s Harpoon only
Hot / Cold / Freezing: no change
Heat Wave or Clear: −5% chance to all items
Jeremy Wade’s Net guarantees a catch regardless of weather.

sections.title: Global Announcements
bullets: FISHER has caught SPECIAL ITEM
FISHER didn't catch anything
FISHER has given SPECIAL ITEM to PLAYER X
FISHER has used SPECIAL ITEM
FISHER has used the LUMINOUS SEASHELL
FISHER has used MOBY DICK'S HARPOON to slay SEA BEAST
FISHER has gained the power of the SEA BEAST

sections.title: Information Revealed via Successful Interrogation or Luminous Seashell
bullets: FISHER caught SPECIAL ITEM
FISHER is giving SPECIAL ITEM to PLAYER X
FISHER is using SPECIAL ITEM
FISHER is summoning SELECTED SEA BEAST
FISHER is voting for PLAYER X
Interrogator Only (Day Before): FISHER voted for PLAYER X
Interrogator Only (Day Before): FISHER used LUMINOUS SEASHELL on PLAYER X

sections.title: Extra Action
bullets: May cast the line again to try to get another item; if caught, it may be used or saved.

name: Guru
flavor: Harnesses Celium Crystals to read aura, cleanse corruption, and manipulate karmic energy across The Island.

sections.title: Core Rules
bullets: The Guru has 4 Crystals available.
May use 1 Crystal each day.
Full Moon / Blood Moon: may take one extra Crystal action (2 total Crystal uses on those days).
Only one Crystal may be used per action; Crystal 4 (Karmic Vessel) is special and has give/recall rules listed below.

sections.title: Crystal 1 — Parlay Prism
bullets: Allows the Guru to read the Parlay activity for that day.
The Guru receives a list of all Parlay objectives that were submitted that day.
The Guru does not see any individual Parlay cards or which players submitted them.
The Guru is not allowed to discuss Parlay strategy with Parlay Players.
The Guru may share the Parlay objective list with the current players on The Island.

sections.title: Crystal 2 — Purity Stone
bullets: Allows the Guru to cleanse 1 player.
Cleansing removes negative effects such as Poison and effects that prevent a role from happening (role-blocks).
Jailing cannot be cleansed; the player will still be unable to perform their role if jailed.
Cleansing may still remove other negative effects on a jailed player (but does not remove the jail itself).

sections.title: Crystal 3 — Revelation Quartz (Aura Read)
bullets: Allows the Guru to read the aura of 1 player.
The Guru receives one aura reading based on what applies to that player for the day.
Aura Readings:
Sensing Danger: the player is being targeted or targeting a player for an attack.
Sensing Hostility: the player is acting against the Guru (examples: voting for the Guru, attempting to attack the Guru, poisoning the Guru, or using a negative effect on the Guru).
Sensing Peace: the player is receiving or giving positive effects (examples: healing, armor, protection, buffs).
Sensing Toxicity: the player is being poisoned or is poisoning.
Priority if multiple apply: Hostility > Danger > Toxicity > Peace.

sections.title: Crystal 4 — Karmic Vessel
bullets: The Guru gives the Karmic Vessel to a player. The Vessel stores the holder’s aura over time based on their actions.
Handing out the Karmic Vessel counts as using a Crystal for that day.
Recalling the Karmic Vessel counts as using a Crystal for that day.
The Guru may recall the Vessel at any time, but will not know its charge until it returns.
Recall rule: Recalling counts as the action, but the Guru may immediately re-give it the same day instead of doing anything else with crystals.

sections.title: Karmic Vessel — Negative Actions Tracked
bullets: NEGATIVE ACTIONS INCLUDE:
Poisoning.
Attacking players.
Voting on the Guru.
Applying effects that stop a player from doing their role (does not include Jailing).
Negative actions take priority: if any Negative Action is taken that day, the Vessel charges negatively that day (even if a Positive Action also occurred).
Neutral actions (no positive or negative) do not move the Vessel’s charge.

sections.title: Karmic Vessel — Positive Actions Tracked
bullets: POSITIVE ACTIONS INCLUDE:
Healing.
Giving armor.
Lively Lemons.
Protecting against attacks.
Teacher Buff.

sections.title: Karmic Vessel — Charging Rules
bullets: Normal Days: Negative day = -1 charge, Positive day = +1 charge.
Full Moon / Blood Moon: Negative day = -2 charge, Positive day = +2 charge.
Charge persists until changed by an action day.
Example: If the Vessel is at -2 and the holder does a Positive Action, the Vessel becomes -1.
Example: If the Vessel is at -3 and the holder does nothing positive or negative, it remains -3 until an action changes it.

sections.title: Karmic Vessel — Negative Effects (applies to current holder)
bullets: Negative -1 (Tainted): Increase poison received from sources by +1.
Negative -2 (Cursed): Increase poison received by +1; reduce healing received by -1; reduce role success chance by -20% (only for roles it can apply to).

Negative -3 (Blighted): Increase poison received by +2; reduce healing received by -2; reduce role success chance by -20% (only for roles it can apply to); consume -2 food per day instead of -1; increase the chance of getting sick.

Negative -4 (Doomed): Increase poison received by +2; reduce healing received by -2; reduce role success chance by -25% (only for roles it can apply to); consume -2 food per day instead of -1; increase the chance of getting sick; all votes toward that player are doubled (works until the Top 4).

sections.title: Karmic Vessel — Positive Effects (applies to current holder)
bullets: Positive +1 (Blessed): Increase healing received from sources by +1.
Positive +2 (Radiant): Increase healing received by +1; reduce poison received by -1; increase role success chance by +10% (only for roles it can apply to).

Positive +3 (Exalted): Increase healing received by +2; reduce poison received by -2; increase role success chance by +20% (only for roles it can apply to); votes counted against the player are halved (works until the Top 4).

Positive +4 (Promised): Increase healing received by +2; reduce poison received by -2; increase role success chance by +25% (only for roles it can apply to); votes counted against the player are halved (works until the Top 4).

GURU has used PURITY STONE on PLAYER X
GURU has used REVELATION QUARTZ on PLAYER X
GURU has given KARMIC VESSEL to PLAYER X
GURU has recalled KARMIC VESSEL

sections.title: Extra Action
bullets: On Full Moon and Blood Moon days, the Guru may use one additional Crystal (2 total Crystal uses on those days).

name: Hunter
flavor: Hunts for Special Animals with unique powers, storage rules, and weather modifiers.

sections.title: Special Animals
bullets: Ethereal Eagle (15%): choose who the Eagle protects at night from Cannibal/Werewolf.
Envious Fox (15%): allows the Hunter to tell a story like the Bard.
Mystical Owl (15%): see detailed voting and attacks for the day (who votes for who, and who will be attacked).
Jinxed Jackrabbit (15%): jinx a player (cannot use role or vote).
Sif, The Great Grey Wolf: protects the Hunter from Cannibal/Werewolf/Assassin at 100% and has a 100% base chance to kill the attacker on the night of the attack.

sections.title: Storage & Food Dependency
bullets: May store 1 Special Animal for later and still hunt again the next day.
If an animal is stored, Hunter may use both the stored animal and the newly found animal that day.
Hunter depends on Cook for food; if no Cook exists, food is not gained from Hunter (but hunting still works).

sections.title: Weather Modifiers
bullets: Clear: +10% to Sif, The Great Grey Wolf only
Hot / Cold / Heat Wave: no change
Freezing or Rainy: −5% chance to all animals
Robin Hood’s Hat guarantees a successful hunt regardless of weather.

sections.title: Global Announcements
bullets: HUNTER has found SPECIAL ANIMAL
HUNTER didn't find anything
HUNTER has given SPECIAL ANIMAL to PLAYER X
HUNTER has used SPECIAL ANIMAL
HUNTER has used ENVIOUS FOX
SIF THE GREAT GREY WOLF has killed ATTACKER X

HUNTER is giving SPECIAL ANIMAL to PLAYER X
HUNTER is using SPECIAL ANIMAL
HUNTER is voting for PLAYER X
Interrogator Only (Day Before): HUNTER voted for PLAYER X

sections.title: Extra Action
bullets: May hunt again; if another animal is found it may be used or saved.

name: Interrogator
flavor: Interrogates players for insight, can audit votes, and may execute with the Machete From Hell.

sections.title: Interrogation
bullets: May interrogate one player each day.
Base 50% chance of success.
Interrogating a jailed player: 70% chance of success.
Teacher Buff: 100% chance of success.

sections.title: Successful Interrogation Reveals
bullets: What a player’s actions will be for that day.
Who that player is voting for that day.
What actions that player did the day before.
Who that player voted for the day before.
If the player used a Secret Role the day before (reveals only that a Secret Role was used, not which one).

sections.title: Vote Audit (3 Day Cooldown)
bullets: Option A: public vote — everyone sees exactly who votes for who; lies cannot interfere.
Option B: private vote — only Interrogator sees; can be manipulated by lies.

sections.title: Machete From Hell Execution
bullets: If given the Machete From Hell, may execute the player voted off that day.
Decision is made that night after the vote-off is confirmed.
Cannot execute previously kicked off players.
Executed players cannot be brought back from the dead.

sections.title: Global Announcements
bullets: INTERROGATOR will be interrogating PLAYER X
INTERROGATOR has called for a VOTE AUDIT. All votes will be public.
INTERROGATOR has called for a VOTE AUDIT. All votes will be shown to the INTERROGATOR alone.
INTERROGATOR has received the MACHETE FROM HELL
INTERROGATOR has executed KICKED OFF PLAYER. KICKED OFF PLAYER is bared from returning on The Island.

sections.title: Information Revealed via Successful Interrogation or Luminous Seashell

INTERROGATOR will be calling for a VOTE AUDIT

INTERROGATOR is voting for PLAYER X
Interrogator Only (Day Before): INTERROGATOR voted for PLAYER X
In the case of a personal vote audit, all that information is shared if the Interrogator is interrogated or given the Luminous Seashell.

sections.title: Extra Action
bullets: May interrogate another player on the same day (cannot be the same player as earlier that day).

name: Jailor
flavor: A classic protector who can jail players and force Prisoner’s Dilemmas.

sections.title: Jail
bullets: May jail 1 player each day; they are released the next day.
Jailed player cannot perform their role; Wizard and Mimic can still do Secret Role abilities unless it is a Sacred Jail.
A player cannot be jailed two days in a row.
Jailed player is protected from Cannibal and Werewolf attacks.
Assassin can still assassinate a jailed player unless it is a Sacred Jail.
Jailed player can still be poisoned and healed (unless Sacred Jail).

sections.title: Sacred Jail (Builder Upgrade)
bullets: Wizard and Mimic cannot use Secret Roles while jailed.
Assassin cannot break in to assassinate a jailed player.
Jailed player cannot vote.
Jailed player cannot be poisoned.

sections.title: Prisoner’s Dilemma (3 Day Cooldown)
bullets: Pick 2 non-jailed players to face a dilemma (cannot reuse the same pair).
Each chooses Cooperate or Defect; only Jailor is notified of choices.
Both Cooperate: no negative repercussions.
One Cooperate / one Defect: the Cooperator cannot vote that day; Defector unchanged.
Both Defect: votes against both players are doubled for the day.
If a player in a Prisoner’s Dilemma is successfully interrogated or checked via Luminous Seashell, their choice is relayed to the Interrogator.
This ability cannot be used in the Top 5.

sections.title: Global Announcements
bullets: JAILOR has jailed PLAYER X

PLAYER X and Y have cooperated
PLAYER X has cooperated while PLAYER Y has defected
PLAYER X and PLAYER Y have defected. All votes towards these players will now be doubled for today.

sections.title: Information Revealed via Successful Interrogation or Luminous Seashell
bullets: JAILOR will jail PLAYER X
JAILOR will place PLAYER X and PLAYER Y in a Prisoner's Dilemma

sections.title: Extra Action
bullets: May jail another player in the same day.

name: Medic
flavor: Heals and poisons players and is the Island’s safeguard against disease.

sections.title: Heal & Poison Rules
bullets: May heal and poison two different players on the same day.
Cannot heal/poison the same person twice on the same day.
Cannot poison 2 different people in the same day unless there is an extra action.
May do Heal/Heal or Heal/Poison.
Heal/Poison does 2 Health and 1 Food Point

sections.title: Disease Protection
bullets: Medic is the only safeguard against diseases that occur on the Island.
Without the Medic, players can become ill from unwanted pathogens.

Interrogator Only (Day Before): MEDIC poisoned PLAYER X

sections.title: Extra Action
bullets: May heal or poison again on the same day, but it must be a unique player who was not already poisoned by the Medic that day.

name: Nightguard
flavor: The main protector against Cannibal and Werewolf attacks, watching directions and reacting to threats.

sections.title: Protection & Sightlines
bullets: Initially chooses 1 of 4 directions to watch each night.
Has a passive 35% chance of surviving an attack regardless of direction.
If the correct direction is chosen and an attack occurs, Nightguard is informed who they saw and whether the attacker was Cannibal.
If the attacker was Werewolf, Nightguard only learns they saw a Werewolf (identity not revealed).
It is up to Nightguard to tell the Island; the Island may only be notified of an attack and the secret role, not identity.

sections.title: Lies & Announcements
bullets: Nightguard can be lied to.
An announcement may go out if Nightguard is told an attack occurred, or none if told there was no attack.

sections.title: Machete From Hell
bullets: If given the Machete From Hell, Nightguard can attempt to defend the attacked player.
Defense success chance: 50%, assuming Nightguard guessed the correct direction (cannot defend outside sightline).

THE NIGHTGUARD was unable to protected PLAYER X from WEREWOLF

sections.title: Extra Action
bullets: May protect another direction (including the same direction already chosen).

name: Priest
flavor: Wields a holy relic to protect from poison and return players to the Island.

sections.title: Cross Pendant
bullets: May give a Cross Pendant to a player each day (including self).
Pendant lasts one day; a new player must be chosen each day.
Same player cannot receive the Cross Pendant two days in a row.
Pendant grants immunity from all poisons and taking damage.
Pendant wearer cannot be killed by Assassin, Cannibal, Werewolf, or other events unless explicitly stated to cancel the Pendant.
If placed on the Wizard, the Wizard cannot cast spells that day.

sections.title: Resurrection
bullets: May bring back a player no longer on the Island if they are not restricted from returning.
Resurrection has a 3-day cooldown.

sections.title: Global Announcements
bullets: PLAYER X has been RESSURECTED/BROUGHT BACK
PLAYER X has been given the CROSS PENDANT

sections.title: Information Revealed via Successful Interrogation or Luminous Shell
bullets: PRIEST is given the CROSS PENDANT to PLAYER X
PRIEST is voting for PLAYER X
Interrogator Only (Day Before): PRIEST voted for PLAYER X

sections.title: Extra Action
bullets: Receives a second Cross Pendant to hand out that day.
The same restriction still applies: the Pendant cannot be given to the same player twice in a row.

name: Scavenger
flavor: Finds berries and powerful artifacts with rarity; may hold them until the Top 4.

sections.title: Special Artifacts (10% each)
bullets: Alternate Timeline: allows the Scavenger to enter alternate timelines where events may have played out differently.
The Equalizer: allows the Scavenger to equalize the Island.
The Summoning Key: allows the Scavenger to summon a Great One.
Celium Piece: allows the Scavenger to harness the power of one of the Celium Pieces.

sections.title: Holding Items
bullets: Scavenger may hold artifacts and use them later.
Artifacts are taken away in the Top 4.
Indiana Jones Satchel increases chance to find artifacts by +5%.

sections.title: Global Announcements
bullets: SCAVENGER has failed to find an Artifact
SCAVENGER has found SPECIAL ARTIFACT

sections.title: Information Revealed via Successful Interrogation or Luminous Shell

name: Tailor
flavor: Keeps the Island healthy by making weather-appropriate clothes and special outfits for key roles.

sections.title: Clothing Rules
bullets: Makes clothes for the whole Island every day.
Goal is to match clothing to the weather; mistakes can cause negative consequences.
Tailor makes clothing not on the day of, but the day before (special clothes can be made day-of).
If Tailor is removed, the last clothing made remains, but decays in 2 days and increases chances of disease.

sections.title: Special Clothing Options
bullets: Old McDonald's Overalls: guarantees successful Farmer harvest regardless of weather.
Jeremy Wade's Net: guarantees Fisher catch regardless of weather.
Robin Hood's Hat: guarantees Hunter successful hunt regardless of weather.
Indiana Jones Satchel: increases Scavenger artifact odds by +5%.

sections.title: Global Announcements
bullets: TAILOR has made CLOTHES for The Island
TAILOR has made SPECIAL CLOTHES for PLAYER X

sections.title: Information Revealed via Successful Interrogation or Luminous Seashell

TAILOR is making SPECIAL CLOTHES for PLAYER X
TAILOR is voting for PLAYER X
Interrogator Only (Day Before): TAILOR voted for PLAYER X

sections.title: Extra Action
bullets: May make another piece of Special Clothing for another role.

name: Teacher
flavor: A resource of knowledge who can replace roles and apply a powerful buff.

sections.title: Teach a Role (3 Day Cooldown)
bullets: May teach any role to any player regardless of whether the role is currently on the Island.
Teaching replaces the player’s old role (consent does not matter).
A taught role cannot be used that same day.
If the player’s previous role already took action that day, those actions still remain.

sections.title: Teacher Buff Rules
bullets: May buff a player; buff ends after the day is over.
Cannot buff the same player twice in a row.

sections.title: Teacher Buff Effects
bullets: Prevents false information from being given to the survivor.
Increase the Heal/Poison of the player applying it by 1.
Increases healing applied to a player by 1.
Decreases poison applied to a player by 1.
Increases Blacksmith armor applied to 75%.
Makes Interrogation 100% successful.
Increases chances of a successful assassination by +12.5%.
Increases Farmer/Fisher/Hunter/Scavenger chances by +10%.

sections.title: Global Announcements
bullets: TEACHER has taught ROLE to PLAYER X
TEACHER has buffed PLAYER X

sections.title: Information Revealed via Successful Interrogation or Luminous Seashell
bullets: TEACHER will buff PLAYER X
TEACHER will teach ROLE to PLAYER X
TEACHER is voting for PLAYER X
Interrogator Only (Day Before): TEACHER voted for PLAYER X

sections.title: Extra Action
bullets: May buff another player (still cannot buff the same player twice in a row).

name: Cannibal
flavor: Secret Role — Choose a side of the Island to attack from and attempt to kill a target.

sections.title: Rules
bullets: The Cannibal may choose to attack from North, East, West, or South and select a target to kill.
The Cannibal does not have to attack every day.
If the Cannibal does not attack for 2 consecutive days, the Cannibal role is lost.
If the target is protected in some way, the attempt is announced as a failed attempt.
If the Nightguard does not spot the attempt, the Cannibal's identity remains secret (unless revealed through interrogation).

bullets: PLAYER X has been killed by the CANNIBAL

sections.title: Extra Action
bullets: No extra action can be taken with this Secret Role.

name: Mimic
flavor: Secret Role — Copy the ability of any survivor currently on the Island.

sections.title: Rules
bullets: The Mimic may use an ability from any survivor currently on the Island.
The Mimic cannot mimic the same role twice in a row.
The Mimic can mimic while in Jail.

name: Werewolf
flavor: Secret Role — Can attempt to kill on the Full Moon or Blood Moon by choosing an attack side.

sections.title: Rules
bullets: The Werewolf may kill a chosen target on the Full Moon or Blood Moon only.
The Werewolf chooses the side to attack from: North, East, West, or South.
If the target is protected in some way, the attempt is announced as a failed attempt.
Even if the Werewolf is spotted, the Werewolf's identity remains secret.

name: Wizard
flavor: Secret Role — Cast spells to help or threaten the Island. Can cast one Basic spell and one Advanced spell in the same day.

sections.title: Core Rules
bullets: The Wizard has a variety of spells to help or threaten the Island.
The Wizard can bypass being jailed.
The Wizard cannot cast spells if blocked by the Priest’s pendant effect (if applicable) or if the entire Island is weakened by an event.
The Wizard may cast 1 Basic Spell and 1 Advanced Spell in the same day.

sections.title: Basic Spells
bullets: Poison Mist: Target loses 3 HP and 3 Food.
Weaken: Prevents a survivor from performing their role and prevents them from voting.
Great Heal: Target gains 3 HP and 3 Food.
False Voting: Cast an additional vote.

sections.title: Advanced Spells
bullets: Role Switch: Permanently switch 2 players' roles. Cooldown: 3 days. (Roles being switched must still exist on the Island when cast.)
Immunity: Grants immunity to being kicked off the Island. Cooldown: 4 days.
Revive: Brings back a person who was killed. Cooldown: 3 days.
Return: Brings back a person who was kicked off. Cooldown: 3 days.
Charm: Takes full control of a player (their actions and their vote).
